revised_title: Account of the Earthquake Felt along the Coast of England
tldr: This article reports on the earthquake experienced along the coast of England between Margate and Dover on February 18, 1755. The author, Samuel Warren, provides accounts from various individuals who felt the tremor, including Mr. Valentine Jewell, Dr. St. Leger, and the Rev. Mr. Bunce. The article also mentions the calm and hazy weather conditions before a great tempest occurred.
